summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The VMRALLOCATIONINFO structure is used in the VMR-7 filter's method.

member.name: VMRALLOCATIONINFO.dwFlags
member.summary: A bitwise OR of flags from the enumeration.

member.name: VMRALLOCATIONINFO.lpHdr
member.summary: Pointer to the BITMAPINFOHEADER structure associated with the surface.

member.name: VMRALLOCATIONINFO.lpPixFmt
member.summary: Pointer to the DDPIXELFORMAT structure associated with the surface.

member.name: VMRALLOCATIONINFO.szAspectRatio
member.summary: A structure that specifies the aspect ratio of the new surface.

member.name: VMRALLOCATIONINFO.dwMinBuffers
member.summary: The minimum number of buffers to create for this surface.

member.name: VMRALLOCATIONINFO.dwMaxBuffers
member.summary: The maximum number of buffers to create for this surface.

member.name: VMRALLOCATIONINFO.dwInterlaceFlags
member.summary: A bitwise OR of flags that indicate the interlacing. For a list of flags, see the dwInterlaceFlags member of the VIDEOINFOHEADER2 structure.

member.name: VMRALLOCATIONINFO.szNativeSize
member.summary: The size of the native video rectangle.
